newsitem.title: UK: Fitch rates ABN AMRO AA plus long-term.
newsitem.headline: Fitch rates ABN AMRO AA plus long-term.

text.p: Fitch Investors Service said on Wednesday it had assigned a long-term counterparty rating of AA plus to ABN AMRO Bank NV.
"The rating reflects the bank's conservative management style, good funding access and important role within the Dutch and international financial sectors," Fitch said in a statement.
"Asset quality is extremely high, characterised by a low-risk loan portfolio, few non-performing loans and excess reserve coverage," it said.
But Fitch added that concerns were focussed on recent balance sheet expansion, which it said was currently outpacing capital growth.
"The bank is also faced with the challenge of increasing underwriting capabilities in order to more effectively use its far-reaching investment banking network," Fitch said.
It said ABM AMRO's management's business development strategies were likely to result in acquisitions to the U.S. mid-West retail operations on a similar scale to past acquisitions.
